Specific Details: To ensure that support for the community, voluntary, charity and social enterprise sector is recognised in the formation of policies and election manifestos. Subject Matter: To ensure that support for the community, voluntary, charity and social enterprise sector is recognised in the formation of policies and election manifestos. To highlight the issue of pay parity within the sector, particularly in section 39/56/10 organisations where sector organisations are doing identical work to their public sector colleagues.
Intended Results: To ensure that support for the community, voluntary, charity and social enterprise sector is recognised in the formation of policies and election manifestos. To highlight the issue of pay parity within the sector, particularly in section 39/56/10 organisations where sector organisations are doing identical work to their public sector colleagues.
Lobbying Activities: Together with colleagues Colette Bennett and John Gallagher, a meeting with Paul Donnelly TD in Leinster House to discuss sector issues, pay parity, and funding.|Meeting|1::Follow up email to Paul Donnelly TD with additional information requested.|Email|1

Specific Details: With Community Platform members, sharing/presenting the Community Platform Manifesto for the Local, European and General Elections
DPOs Lobbied: Paul Donnelly|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: With Community Platform members, sharing/presenting the Community Platform Manifesto for the Local, European and General Elections
Intended Results: For candidates/parties to address the proposals in the Community Platform Manifesto for the Local, European and General Elections and integrate them into their Election Manifestos. It makes proposals under 4 key areas: the eradication of poverty, the delivery of a universal public model of early years care and education and school age childcare, the implementation of an effective model of collaborative governance, the creation of inclusive, resilient, sustainable and empowered communities
Lobbying Activities: Emails sharing the Community Platform Manifesto and seeking a meeting to present and discuss proposals.|Email|2-5::Meeting to present and discuss proposals in the Community Platform Manifesto|Meeting|1

Lobbyist Name: Irish National Organisation of the Unemployed
Specific Details: As part of the Community Platform, the INOU met with Paul Donnelly, Sinn Fein on the Platform’s election manifesto. The Platform has prioritised four key areas it is asking political parties and independents to address: eradication of poverty; delivery of a universal public model of early years care and education and school age childcare; implementation of an effective model of collaborative governance; creation of inclusive, resilient, sustainable and empowered communities.
DPOs Lobbied: Paul Donnelly|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: As part of the Community Platform, the INOU met with Paul Donnelly, Sinn Fein on the Platform’s election manifesto. The Platform has prioritised four key areas it is asking political parties and independents to address: eradication of poverty; delivery of a universal public model of early years care and education and school age childcare; implementation of an effective model of collaborative governance; creation of inclusive, resilient, sustainable and empowered communities.
Intended Results: Platform members believe these elections present an opportunity to address many long-term inequalities in our society, involving the eradication of poverty; provision of universal, accessible and affordable public services and decent jobs; creation of inclusive, resilient, sustainable and empowered communities. These priorities are rooted in the values of dignity, social and economic justice, equality, solidarity, social and economic inclusion, sustainability, participation, and transparency.
Lobbying Activities: |Meeting|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Bríd O'Brien, Head of Policy and Media
